original: Lundh, Erik Axel Fredrik, fd. landshövding, bankdirektör, Göteborg, f. 8/ 2/95 i Näshulta, Södermani. 1., av godsäg. Axel L. o. Ingeborg Lindroth, G. 28 m. Gunhild Terberger. Barn: Erik f. 28. — Stud:ex. 14, res:off:ex. 16, avg:ex. fr. ’skog^shögsk. 20. Aman. h. domänstyr. 20-21, skogsindeln :assist. 21, a&sist. v. skogshögsk. 22-26, bitr. sekr. 25 o. sekr. i centr:rådet f. skogs-v:styr. förb. 28, sekr. i Skogsveckan 24, i Sv. skogsv :fören. 26, doc. i skogsskötsel v. skogshögsk. 27, utredn :man f. omorg. av högre skogsv :und :visn. 35, landshövd. i Kronob. 1. 44-46, dir. f. Skand. Banken i Gbg sed. 46. Led. av 31 års skogssakk. o. av 32 o. 36 års utredn. ang. beredsk :arb., stat. förlikn:man i första distr. 38, ordf. i Norrl. skogsproduktionsutredn. 39 o. i stat. bränslekomm. 40. KNOlkl, KTyskÖO, KFinlVROlkl, ’ RDDO, RFrdeMagr, RNS :t001k:l, LIVA.
translated: Lundh, Erik Axel Fredrik, former county governor, bank director, Gothenburg, born on 8/2/95 in Näshulta, Södermanland. Son of estate owner Axel L. and Ingeborg Lindroth. Married on 28 to Gunhild Terberger. Children: Erik, born in 1928. Completed studies: high school graduation in 1914, military officer examination in 1916, forestry examination from the Forestry High School in 1920. Assistant in the Royal forestry board in 1920-1921, forestry industry assistant in 1921, assistant teacher at the Forestry High School in 1922-1926, deputy secretary in 1925 and secretary in the Central Council for the Western Forestry Association in 1928, secretary at the Forestry Week in 1924, in the Swedish Forestry Association in 1926, lecturer in forest management at the Forestry High School in 1927, investigator for the advancement of higher forestry education in 1935, county governor of Kronoberg in 1944-1946, director of the Skandinaviska Banken in Gothenburg since 1946. Member of the Forest Advisory Committee for 31 years, and participated in investigations regarding preparedness work in 1932 and 1936. State mediator in the first district in 1938, chairman of the Northern Forest Production Investigation in 1939 and the State Fuel Committee in 1940. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Commander of the Order of the Three Stars (Latvia), Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Knight of the Royal Norwegian Order of Merit, Knight of the Swedish Red Cross, and Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Agriculture and Forestry (LIVA).
